basic.description:
An introduction to the role of computation in theories of the mind and thought. Surveys the major models developed to account for various specific aspects of human cognitive processes. Unitary models of cognitive processes are also examined.
LEARNING HOURS    120 (36L;84P)
basic.subject: COGS
basic.title: Cognition and Computation

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisites    PSYC221 or COGS100.
Exclusion    No more than 6.0 units from COGS200; COGS201; PSYC220.
